item.title: Abandoned broken glass mouldy car, 21st February
item.description:
This car has been sitting outside our flat for almost two months. It has its windows broken, glass everywhere and is mouldy all inside. Please remove it.

item.title: Double yellow not painted properly, 21st February
item.description:
It looks like double yellow lines have recently been painted but they do not extend away from the speed restriction barriers enough and cars are parking to close making it hard to get through the barriers. Also old cars that never move are restricting the ability to paint properly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping, 21st February
item.description:
Large amount of fly tipping I am adding an address that can be seen in one of the boxes there is a fine for fly tipping and without it you cannot enforce it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheppard Drive, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights out. Re occuring problem., 20th February
item.description:
The service rd lights between Rail Sidings Rd and Dockley Rd along with the walk through and stairwell to Lucey are not working AGAIN. This is a frequently re occuring problem that needs to be resolved once and for all. Although there is some lighting from the trading estate that partially illuminates the service rd, the walk through and stairwell between 72 and 74 Lucey way is dark and dangerous for vulnerable people. It also encourages the dumping of rubbish at the foot of the stairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous pot hole, 20th February
item.description:
URGENT Popped my car tyre 20/02 13:15 Single lane traffic due to temp lights & roadworks. No signage to inform of danger. Could not see cones on the approach. Cones are 1) not in the correct place 2) submerged 3) squashed on their side Witnessed other vehicles also suffering with damage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whitewebbs Lane, Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 30 Grafton way on the road near the parking bay, 20th February
item.description:
This loose sunken manhole has been damaged loose and making a horrendous noise for nearly 4 months Grafton way has an extremely high level of traffic all day and night and the noise is driving me insane cars hit it every couple of seconds when I have been outside side monitoring it I can actually see the cover lift right up when cars drive over it we have very large heavy lorries use this road and it’s only a matter of time before this loose sunken manhole cover causes an accident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole damaging vehicle and causing a hazard to traffic, 20th February
item.description:
This pothole has been present for months, this is a danger to both road users and pedestrians. Traffic swerving to avoid, disgraceful that the council hasn’t repaired this damage. They will be at risk of legal action if someone gets hurt given the previous reports from months ago yet no action taken by the council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Crown Dale, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Kossoffs bakery, 20th February
item.description:
The button for the crossing is broken on one side of the street (Kossoffs side), so the traffic light does not change to allow pedestrians to cross. The button has been not working well for the last few weeks, but now it is not working at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 259, Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy drain cover, 20th February
item.description:
Drain cover rattling/clanking when driven over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, North Cray Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling, 20th February
item.description:
Piles of mess along Barnfield Road perpetrated by a "small" 50Kg brown and tan/ black Bully dog. Owner obviously aware as this is a preferred route and 3 separate piles of mess now in place. Passed him on route but wouldn't want to antagonise either party.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnfield Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
